Policies and Initiatives.title: Dell, NxtGen to build 'India’s largest AI training cluster' under sovereign cloud
Policies and Initiatives.summary: Dell and NxtGen are collaborating to build India's largest AI training cluster under a sovereign cloud project. The project will utilize over 4,000 NVIDIA GPUs to enhance domestic AI computing capabilities. This initiative aims to support enterprises, startups, academia, and government entities in India.

Policies and Initiatives.title: 60% of businesses confident in scaling AI, but gaps remain: Nasscom Report
Policies and Initiatives.summary: Indian businesses are showing confidence in scaling AI, with 60% expressing optimism, and many prioritizing Responsible AI, having mature practices and formal frameworks in place. The BFSI sector leads in AI maturity, but challenges such as hallucinations and privacy concerns still exist. Businesses with higher AI maturity are better prepared for emerging technologies, but require framework updates to support advanced AI systems.

Policies and Initiatives.title: From silicon to systems: India’s integrated approach to semiconductors and AI
Policies and Initiatives.summary: India's AI Mission is developing a comprehensive approach to semiconductors and AI, utilizing over 38,000 GPUs and indigenous models. The initiative aims to establish national sovereignty and create a secure ecosystem for governance and innovation. This effort also involves fostering vast talent hubs to drive sectoral innovation.

Policies and Initiatives.title: Why Elon Musk's Grok is in trouble in India while ChatGPT and Gemini are not—for now
Policies and Initiatives.summary: Elon Musk's AI image tool Grok is facing issues in India due to user complaints. In contrast, other AI tools like ChatGPT and Gemini have not faced similar problems in the country, at least not yet. The controversy surrounding Grok highlights the challenge of balancing creative freedom with content moderation in AI image generation.

Policies and Initiatives.title: Mint Explainer | Grok AI controversy: Why Elon Musk’s chatbot has alarmed India’s IT ministry
Policies and Initiatives.summary: Elon Musk's chatbot, Grok AI, has sparked controversy and alarm from India's IT ministry, prompting a 72-hour takedown order against its parent company X. The incident highlights the challenges of containing online abuse with increasingly powerful AI tools. India's Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY) is addressing the issue, reflecting a broader concern about AI's role in online harassment.

Policies and Initiatives.title: India targets large-scale skilling in AI, cybersecurity and quantum technologies by 2030
Policies and Initiatives.summary: India aims to upskill five million learners by 2030 in fields like AI, cybersecurity, and quantum technologies. The initiative will be carried out through a digital platform in partnership with educational bodies to integrate new curricula and provide hands-on experiences. This effort seeks to equip students and adults with future-ready skills, promoting innovation from school to higher education.

Policies and Initiatives.title: AI to add $1.7 trillion to India's economy by 2035: Govt
Policies and Initiatives.summary: AI is expected to add $1.7 trillion to India's economy by 2035, driven by its adoption across various sectors. The sectors that will benefit from AI include healthcare, agriculture, manufacturing, and financial services, among others. AI will improve productivity and service delivery in these areas through automation and data-driven decision-making.

Major AI Developments.title: Indian, US researchers develop AI-based eye scan to detect diabetes
Major AI Developments.summary: Researchers from India and the US have collaborated to develop an AI-based eye scan that can detect diabetes. This innovative technology uses artificial intelligence to analyze eye scans and identify signs of diabetes. The AI-based eye scan has the potential to provide a non-invasive and efficient method for diabetes detection.

Major AI Developments.title: AI and unstructured data: A roadmap for India's digital transformation with elastic CEO
Major AI Developments.summary: Elastic CEO discusses the role of AI in India's digital transformation, focusing on the potential of unstructured data. The conversation highlights the importance of harnessing unstructured data to drive business growth and innovation in India. Elastic CEO provides a roadmap for India's digital transformation, leveraging AI and unstructured data to achieve this goal.

Major AI Developments.title: How AI-driven platforms are transforming Rs 32 lakh crore Indian retail market - What EY NASSCOM report revealed
Major AI Developments.summary: A report by EY India and NASSCOM reveals that AI-driven platforms are set to transform the Indian retail market, valued at Rs 32 lakh crore. The report predicts that 2026 will be the year of "Productive Retail," driven by technological advancements. Generative AI is expected to boost sector productivity by up to 37% by 2030.

Major AI Developments.title: PwC India report projects AI to unlock USD 550 billion across five sectors by 2035
Major AI Developments.summary: PwC India's report projects AI to add $550 billion to five key sectors by 2035. The report introduces a 3A2I framework for scaling AI, focusing on access, acceptance, and assimilation, as well as implementation and institutionalization. This framework aims to unlock broader public and economic benefits from AI adoption.

Major AI Developments.title: India’s AI ambition: Can the country turn potential into real-world impact?
Major AI Developments.summary: India is expanding its role in global AI beyond tech talent, becoming a hub for AI design and deployment in enterprises. Global Capability Centers are driving this shift, but scaling AI beyond pilots poses challenges such as data and integration. India aims to turn its AI potential into real-world impact by focusing on execution and measurable business outcomes.

Major AI Developments.title: India's super-rich pooling millions for a slice of world's hottest private AI firms
Major AI Developments.summary: India's ultra-high net worth individuals (UHNIs) are pooling millions to invest in private AI firms globally. This move is driven by soaring valuations in the AI sector, with wealth managers reporting an increase in offshore investments. Indian UHNIs are seeking to tap into the growing global AI market, diversifying their portfolios with international investments.

Major AI Developments.title: Techno-Legal Framework EXPLAINED: India unveils AI governance framework - What it means and how it works?
Major AI Developments.summary: India has unveiled a techno-legal AI governance framework to promote responsible innovation and manage risks. The framework proposes coordinated oversight, safety institutions, expert committees, and an AI incident database. This aims to ensure trusted AI deployment across various sectors in the country.

Major AI Developments.title: India unveils "techno-legal" AI governance framework to balance innovation and risk.
Major AI Developments.summary: India has introduced a "techno-legal" AI governance framework to balance innovation and risk. The framework, titled "Strengthening AI Governance Through Techno-Legal Framework", outlines a comprehensive institutional mechanism for India's AI governance ecosystem. It emphasizes the importance of effective implementation for the success of any policy instrument.

Major AI Developments.title: India's AI adoption to generate $1.7 trillion in economic value by 2035: Report
Major AI Developments.summary: India's adoption of artificial intelligence is projected to generate $1.7 trillion in economic value by 2035. This growth is expected to occur as the country's semiconductor industry scales up. The increased AI adoption will likely reshape various industries across the Indian economy.

Major AI Developments.title: AI-led data centre expansion gathers pace in India amid power, policy challenges
Major AI Developments.summary: India is experiencing rapid growth in AI-led data centre expansion, driven by increasing demand. Despite this growth, the industry faces significant challenges, including power supply constraints and evolving policy frameworks. The expansion is expected to continue, with companies navigating these challenges to meet rising data storage and processing needs.

AI Start-Up News.title: Antler is doubling its checks and speed amidst the flurry of AI companies in India
AI Start-Up News.summary: Antler is adjusting its strategy amidst India's growing AI industry, aiming to reduce cohort size to focus on quality founders and ideas. The firm plans to onboard new cohorts every quarter, increasing its pace and adapting to the AI era. This shift comes after Antler announced its AI residency programme in July 2025.

AI Start-Up News.title: Over 100 Indian AI startup founders moving to US for funds and talent
AI Start-Up News.summary: Over 100 Indian AI startup founders are relocating to the US in search of funding and talent. Several startups, including Composio and Meetstream.ai, have already made the move over the past couple of years. Others, such as Smallest.ai and Beatoven.ai, are also shifting their base to the US.

AI Start-Up News.title: AI film studio TakeTwo secures funding at Rs 100 Cr valuation in pre-seed round
AI Start-Up News.summary: TakeTwo, an AI-native film studio, has secured funding at a valuation of Rs 100 crore in its pre-seed round, with participation from US-based Afore Capital and Canada's Inovia VC. The company, founded by Y Combinator's AI Startup School alumni, aims to be a key technology partner for India's film industry. The funding will be used to develop technical infrastructure and scale its team of creative technologists.

AI Start-Up News.title: Would you raise an AI pet? India’s new digital companions are here
AI Start-Up News.summary: India has introduced various AI-powered virtual pet applications, including Pengu, Widgetable, and Pokipet, allowing users to customize their digital companions. These apps utilize AI technology to create interactive and personalized virtual pets. Indians can now raise and care for their own unique digital pets through these innovative platforms.

AI Start-Up News.title: AI Startups To Watch: 5 Indian AI Startups That Caught Our Eye In January
AI Start-Up News.summary: India's AI ecosystem has gained momentum in 2026, building on the progress made in 2025. Several Indian AI startups have caught attention, showcasing the country's growing presence in the global AI landscape. Five Indian AI startups have been highlighted as notable examples of this trend, demonstrating innovation and potential in the field.

AI Start-Up News.title: A Timely Pivot: How GenAI Allowed SpeakX To Find A New Edtech Mission
AI Start-Up News.summary: SpeakX, an edtech company, has pivoted its mission thanks to the capabilities of GenAI. The company is now leveraging AI to improve English language skills in India, where English proficiency is highly valued. GenAI has enabled SpeakX to find a new direction and purpose in the edtech space.

AI Start-Up News.title: How Upliance Is Solving India’s Biggest Everyday Cooking Pain Point
AI Start-Up News.summary: Upliance.ai is addressing a significant everyday cooking pain point in India through its innovative solutions. The company aims to simplify cooking for Indians by providing a unique approach to meal preparation. By leveraging technology, Upliance.ai is making a notable impact on the traditional cooking methods in the country.
